title: How Eric Holder Sees the Jan. 6 Case Against Donald Trump Unfolding
description: “To be frank, I think that the Justice Department could have done a better job,” Holder said.

title: Robbie Robertson, Lead Guitarist of The Band, Dies at 80
description: Robbie Robertson, The Band's lead guitarist and songwriter who mined and helped reshape American music, has died at 80

title: Chronic Kidney Disease Is Poised To Become The Black Lung of Climate Change
description: Chronic Kidney Disease could be the first climate-change related occupational disease.

title: Teen Rapper Lil Tay Has Died
description: Lil Tay, who rose to fame on the internet for her eccentric videos, has died.

title: Don’t Look Now, But Ohio Might Be A Swing State Again
description: The sweeping failure of a ballot measure pushed by abortion opponents suggests Ohio might be more purple than Democratic strategists realize.

title: Singer Sixto Rodriguez, Subject of the Documentary Searching for Sugarman, Dies at 81
description: The singer Sixto Rodriguez, subject of the Oscar-winning documentary 'Searching for Sugar Man,' died Tuesday at the age of 81

title: Twitter Fined $350,000 in Secret Justice Department Fight Over Trump Records
description: The warrant related to Special Counsel John “Jack” Smith’s criminal investigation into the 2020 election.

title: How to Make AI Work for You, at Work
description: There is increasing concern about the threat AI may pose to workers. Here's how to harness it.

title: Dianne Feinstein Hospitalized After Fall at Home
description: Dianne Feinstein, the oldest member of Congress, fell in her home and went to a hospital, her office said on Wednesday.

title: This Urgent Care Clinic Is Flooding the Internet With Nonsensical Posts. Is AI to Blame?
description: An urgent care clinic appears to be using AI to generate millions of nonsensical posts to boost its Google results.

title: People Flee Into the Ocean To Escape Wildfire Ravaging Popular Maui Tourist Town
description: Wildfires in Hawaii fanned by strong winds burned multiple structures in areas including historic Lahaina town, forcing evacuations.

title: A Mega Millions Ticket for the $1.58 Billion Jackpot Sold in Florida
description: A Publix grocery store in Neptune Beach sold the winning ticket.

title: Biden’s New National Monument Near Grand Canyon is a Tribute to Tribal Heritage and Climate Action
description: Biden's national monument designation turns the decades-long visions of Native American tribes and environmentalists into reality.

title: WeWork’s ‘Substantial Doubt’ About Its Future Marks a Stunning Fall
description: The office rental company's stock has plunged 98% since going public in October 2021.

title: Stella McCartney Is Changing Fashion From Within
description: The designer is fighting to make luxury fashion at LVMH sustainable.

title: Two Visions of Bobby Kennedy Jr.
description: The presidential candidate bears the pain of his tragic childhood

title: China Slides Into Deflation as Consumer and Factory Prices Drop
description: Falling consumer and factory prices are adding pressure on policymakers to step up China's monetary and fiscal support for the economy.

title: Denmark and Sweden’s Commitment to Free Speech Is Wilting in the Face of Quran Burnings
description: After a spate of Quran burnings, the Danish and Swedish governments are buckling to pressure and giving up on their liberal values

title: In Victory for Abortion-Rights Advocates, Ohio Rejects Effort to Make it Harder to Change State Constitution
description: In a victory for abortion-rights advocates, Ohio voters voted down Issue 1, which would have raised the threshold to amend the constitution.

title: Tory Lanez Sentenced to 10 Years in Prison for Shooting Megan Thee Stallion
description: A judge sentenced rapper Tory Lanez to 10 years in prison Tuesday for shooting and wounding hip-hop superstar Megan Thee Stallion.
